result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Kees advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

3:01 PM Defendant Dustin M Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Dustin M Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for plea and sentencing. 
State places the offer on the record. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.

In case 22CM847:
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Counts 2-3 are Dismissed and read in.

In case 22CT954:
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Count 2 is Dismissed and read in.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court. 

In case 22CM847:
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
JAIL: 5 Days - Straight-time.
0  Days Credit.
*Consecutive to the sentence currently being served, but concurrent to case 22CT954; 

Fine:  $442
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $100 per month, starting  12/01/22 and the 1st of every month until paid in full, or be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee. 
Alternate:  Entry of civil judgment

*******************************************

0  Days Credit.
*Consecutive to the sentence currently being served, but concurrent to case 22CM847; 

Fine:  $442
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $100 per month, starting  12/01/22 and the 1st of every month until paid in full, or be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee. 
Alternate:  Entry of civil judgment

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

11:08 AM Defendant Dustin M Smith in court, in custody, with SPD INtern Schlueter.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Judge Carter is covering case for Judge Dorow. 

Defense believes discovery has been exchanged at this point and requests a plea/sentencing hearing date for Atty Kees to be assigned to case that was filed yesterday. Court sets.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

08:34 AM Defendant Dustin M Smith in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Clerk of Court to notify Public Defender's Office to evaluate defendant in the Waukesha County Jail.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
